docs.snippet: TOKYO, May 15 -- Japan has suddenly emerged as an automobile exporting nation. Contracts already are on the books for 6,000 Nissan and Toyopet cars and trucks, most of which will go to Formosa. Nissan makes standardized vehicles and Toyo makes midget...
docs.lead_paragraph: TOKYO, May 15 -- Japan has suddenly emerged as an automobile exporting nation. Contracts already are on the books for 6,000 Nissan and Toyopet cars and trucks, most of which will go to Formosa. Nissan makes standardized vehicles and Toyo makes midget sedans and delivery trucks.
docs.abstract: Japan to export 6,000 vehicles, mostly to Formosa

headline.main: JAPAN RECOVERING AS AUTO EXPORTER; New Orders Booked for 6,000 Nissan and Toyopet Vehicles, Most of Them for Formosa

byline.original: By BURTON CRANESpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Pound sterling stepped back into the orbit as the top interest in the foreign exchanges which it had yielded in the brief interval of the preceding week when the sharp rise of the Canadian free dollar took the spotlight.

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly early today rejected a resolution based on an Anglo-Italian agreement for the disposition of the former Italian colonies in Africa. The vote was 37 against to 14 in favor.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly early today rejected a resolution based on an Anglo-Italian agreement for the disposition of the former Italian colonies in Africa. The vote was 37 against to 14 in favor.
docs.abstract: UN Assembly rejects Brit-Ital adm plan

headline.main: U. N., 37-14, REJECTS BEVIN-SFORZA PLAN ON ROME COLONIES; Assembly Earlier Refused to Back Paragraphs to Give Italy Trusteeships FRANCE CHANGED STAND Her Switch to Opposition From Advocacy Dooms Proposal -- Debate at Flushing Sharp U. N., 37-14, DOOMS BEVIN-SFORZA PLAN

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly ended its spring session at 6:18 o'clock last evening after having decided to postpone a decision on the disposition of the former Italian colonies in Africa until its fourth regular session, which will convene at...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly ended its spring session at 6:18 o'clock last evening after having decided to postpone a decision on the disposition of the former Italian colonies in Africa until its fourth regular session, which will convene at Flushing Meadow on Sept. 20.
docs.abstract: Assembly postpones decision on disposition until Sept session; rejects plans for interim group to weigh issue

headline.main: U. N. ASSEMBLY ENDS ITS SESSION, LEAVING COLONIES UNSOLVED; Move to Set Up Interim Group on the Ex-Italian Areas Is Rejected, 27 to 21

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 25 -- Imports from the United States were limited today by Government order to 25 per cent of the 1947-48 average because of the current dollar exchange shortage.

docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, May 26 -- Emergency contributions from Australia, Austria, Iceland, India, Luxembourg and Thailand [Siam], made in response to a last-gasp appeal, will infuse new life into the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund, Col. A1fred G. Katzin, coordinator of the appeal, reported today.

docs.snippet: The keel for the British India Steam Navigation Company's new liner Kenya has been laid, it was announced yesterday by the Cunard White Star Line, general agents for the company in this country.

docs.snippet: Pound sterling showed a firm undertone last week, reversing the trend and canceling out the nervousness which had been hanging over the markets of the last month. Observers pointed to the fortnight declaration of a prominent New York banker,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pound sterling showed a firm undertone last week, reversing the trend and canceling out the nervousness which had been hanging over the markets of the last month. Observers pointed to the fortnight declaration of a prominent New York banker, presently abroad, that he did not wish to associate himself with those Americans advocating sterling devaluation. This statement, supplemented by equally vigorous views of British spokesmen, proved the factor controlling the upturn.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended May 27, 1949
